intro:
June 22, 2016 was one of the busiest days on record for Citi Bike. The bike-share system, first rolled out to New York City in May 2013, is instantly recognizable to anyone commuting in the city. It is the largest of its kind in the world, one of the busiest, and the only such system of its size that is not government-subsided.

In this visualization, explore a day in the life of the Citi Bike system. Select your favorite station or stations and hit the launch button to live out June 22 2016, one of the busiest days on record for Citi Bike, in one of two modes.

Stations mode visualizes bike-trips to and from your stations of choice. Where do bike trips from these stations go? Where do they come from?

The bikes mode allows you to follow the movements of individual bikes that end or start the day at your station of choice. Where do they come from? Where do they go?
